contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox islands | name = Komsomolets | image name = Komsomolets Island.svg | image caption = Komsomolets Island, Russia | image size = | locator map = {{Location map|Russia|caption=|float=center|width=220|lat=80.566667|long=94.483333}} | map caption = Komsomolets Island (Russia) | native name = остров Комсомолец | native name link = Russian language | nickname = | location = [[Arctic]] | coordinates = {{coord|80|29|03|N|94|59|47|E|region:RU_type:isle_scale:5000000|display=inline}} | archipelago = [[Severnaya Zemlya]] | total islands = | major islands = | area km2 = 9006 | length km = | width km = | highest mount = | elevation m = 935 | country = Russia | country admin divisions title = | country admin divisions = | country admin divisions title 1 = | country admin divisions 1 = | country admin divisions title 2 = | country admin divisions 2 = | country largest city = | country largest city population = | population = | population as of = | density km2 = | ethnic groups = | additional info = }} '''Komsomolets Island''' ({{lang-ru|остров Комсомолец}}) is the northernmost [[island]] of the [[Severnaya Zemlya]] group in the [[Russia]]n [[Arctic]], and the third largest island in the group. It is the [[List of islands by area|82nd largest island]] on earth. There has been a request to rename this island '''Svyataya Mariya''' (St. Maria).<ref>[http://eng.www.r24.kadastr.ru/search/?text=severnaya+zemlya&all_regions=&document_type=&select=0 Search - Krasnoyarsk Territory - Rosnedvizhimost<!-- Bot generated title -->]{{deadlink|date=March 2012}}</ref> ==Geography== The northernmost point of the island is called the [[Arctic Cape]]. This is the launching point for many Arctic expeditions. The area of this island has been estimated at 9,006 km². It rises to a height of 780 m. About 65% of the island is covered with glaciers. Komsomolets Island is home to the largest ice cap in Russia, the Academy of Sciences Ice Cap.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ecoshelf.ru/eng/nauka/exp_4.php | title=Severnaya Zemlya 1999-2000 | publisher=[http://www.ecoshelf.ru Ecoshelf] | accessdate=March 14, 2012}}</ref> ==Geology== The soil of the island is mostly composed of loose [[loam]] and [[sand]]s, a tundra desert scattered with mosses and lichens.<ref>http://web.archive.org/web/20101223015139/http://www.oceandots.com/arctic/severnaya-zemlya Russian Arctic - Severnaya Zemlya<!-- Bot generated title -->{{deadlink|date=March 2012}}</ref> ==History== The island was discovered by [[Boris Vilkitsky]] in 1913, but its insularity wasn’t proven until 1931, when [[Georgy Ushakov]] and [[Nikolay Urvantsev]] charted the archipelago during their 1930–32 expedition.<ref name=Barr1975>{{ cite journal|author=Barr, William |year=1975|title=Severnaya Zemlya: the last major discovery |journal=Geographical Journal|volume=141|number=1|pages=59–71|doi=10.2307/1796946}}</ref> They also named it. In keeping with their scheme of naming the islands after events and movements of the [[Russian Revolution of 1917|Russian Revolution]], this island was named in honour of the members of the [[Komsomol]], the "Communist Union of Youth". ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * Photos of the Academy of Science Ice Cap: [http://www.ecoshelf.ru/eng/nauka/exp_4.php] * Facts and dramatic satellite photos of the islands of the [[Severnaya Zemlya]] group: [http://web.archive.org/web/20101223015139/http://www.oceandots.com/arctic/severnaya-zemlya] {{coord|80|29|03|N|94|59|47|E|type:isle_scale:5000000|display=title}} {{Kara Sea Islands}} {{Laptev Sea Islands}} [[Category:Islands of the Laptev Sea]] [[Category:Islands of the Kara Sea]] [[Category:Komsomol]] [[Category:Islands of Severnaya Zemlya]] {{KrasnoyarskKrai-geo-stub}}
